comments:
When I run a report with java 1.5, it works fine. I got ehn following errors when I switched to java 1.6 with the same report:

edu.umich.umms.ereport.ReportGeneratorException: Error generating report:
Following errors occured while processing:
1.) java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException.

	at edu.umich.umms.reportservice.BirtReportGeneratorService.generateReport(BirtReportGeneratorService.java:112)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
......

-Henry

The exception is thrown out in edu.umich.umms.reportservice.BirtReportGeneratorService.generateReport(BirtReportGeneratorService.java:112), can you attach the source code of that method? 

If the exception is thrown out in BIRT, can you attach the root cause exception?

thanks.

If I remove the chart part form the report, it worked just fine. And it worked well in the eclipse/birt plugin. But when ran a program with the ReportEngine, I got the above errors. So I suspected there are bugs in the chart somewhere in the ReportEngine.

i did a simple test about this bug, listed below:
1. install jdk1.6, the package name is jdk-6u2-windows-i586-p.exe from java.sun.com.
2. install tomcat5.5.23
3. create a simple report design which contains a simple Chart item.
4. start tomcat, all work fine.

in your error stacks, there are some message about the framework Spring, maybe this issue is related to the framework. so can you give me some more information about the whole process and let me reproduce this bug?

can you attach your report design?
pls give me information as more as possible, thanks.

Created an attachment (id=73725)
the report design which works fine on tomcat 5.5.23 with jdk1.6

here is the message from zhlu@umich.edu
-----------------------
here is the error message and attach for report design. What I found out
was that:
1. In the SVGRendererImpl.java file, function after( ),

try
{
writeDocumentToOutputStream( dom,
(OutputStream) oOutputIdentifier );
}
catch ( Exception ex )
{
throw new ChartException( ChartDeviceSVGPlugin.ID,
ChartException.RENDERING,
ex );
}
The writeDocumentToOutputStream failure triggerd thrown exception. But
the question is why writeDocumentToOutputStream() failed?
2. it works java 1.5.
3. it didn't work for java 1.6
4. Please use our mg_dpt_hit.rptdesign for testing and create a set of
tables for its data set for testing.

Created an attachment (id=73822)
the report design
One more error message when I tried with different server version. But the report was still generated with java 1.5.

here is some more message from zhlu@umich.edu
----------------------------------

One more tip:

If i change the outputformat to "PNG", it work just fine for both java
1.5 and 1.6. But the default is SVG, so I think there are some bugs in the SVG code.

Are you using the resin XSLT transform engine?  The reason I'm asking is that I see com.caucho.xml.QDocument.getXmlVersion is being used.

It seems that this implementation of the XSLT engine does not support some of the XSLT operations.

I need to investigate which operation is not supported and determine if there's a work around.

(In reply to comment #9)
> Are you using the resin XSLT transform engine?  The reason I'm asking is that I
> see com.caucho.xml.QDocument.getXmlVersion is being used.
> It seems that this implementation of the XSLT engine does not support some of
> the XSLT operations.
> I need to investigate which operation is not supported and determine if there's
> a work around.

I'm still waiting for information from the bug reporter regarding the above question.

Since I didn't recieve any more information from the owner I'm closing this bug.

Furthermore BIRT does not currently support jdk 1.6.

From the download page http://download.eclipse.org/birt/downloads/ it states that BIRT Pre-reqs: Java 1.4.2/1.5 JDK/JRE and not JDK 1.6
